Review of the literature

Effect of temperature and salinity on reproductive patterns

The following salinity ranges were compared:

  • 25 ppm

  • 30 ppm

  • 35 ppm

Results were as follows

Salinity Carapace Width Time to Instar 3
25 5cm 22 days
30 4cm 18 days
35 3cm 16 days

\[ P(A|B) = \frac{P(B|A)P(B)}{P(A)} \]

Latex equation. 1

I think quarto is a great language - Anonymous 2020

  1. Latex equations let you write math inline

flowchart LR
  A[Hard edge] --> B(Round edge)
  B --> C{Decision}
  C --> D[Result one]
  C --> E[Result two]

this is my citations (McConaugha et al. 1980) (Ong and Costlow 1970)

References

McConaugha, John R., Kathy McNally, Joseph W. Goy, and John D. Costlow. 1980. “WINTER INDUCED MATING IN THE STONE CRAB, Menippe Mercenaria.” Proceedings of the World Mariculture Society 11 (1-4): 544–47. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1749-7345.1980.tb00148.x.
Ong, Kah-Sin, and John D. Costlow. 1970. “The Effect of Salinity and Temperature on the Larval Development of the Stone Crab,Menippe Mercenaria (Say), Reared in the Laboratory.” Chesapeake Science 11 (1): 16–29. https://doi.org/10.2307/1351338.
